title: Neonatal Early-Onset Sepsis Calculator
description: Calculates risk of early-onset neonatal sepsis based on maternal intrapartum risk factors for newborns ≥34 weeks gestation. Uses multivariate predictive model to estimate probability of culture-positive sepsis within 72 hours of birth.

parameters.name: gestational_age_weeks
parameters.description: Gestational age in weeks (e.g., 38.5 for 38 weeks 3 days)

parameters.name: maternal_temp_celsius
parameters.description: Highest maternal antepartum temperature in Celsius

parameters.name: rom_hours
parameters.description: Duration of rupture of membranes (ROM) in hours

parameters.name: antibiotics_type
parameters.description: Type and timing of intrapartum antibiotics

result.name: eos_risk_per_1000
result.description: Early-onset sepsis risk per 1000 live births

ranges.interpretation: Very low risk of early-onset sepsis. Routine care appropriate with continued observation for clinical signs.
Low risk of early-onset sepsis. Enhanced observation may be considered based on clinical judgment.
Intermediate risk of early-onset sepsis. Enhanced observation recommended. Consider blood culture and empiric antibiotics based on clinical examination.
High risk of early-onset sepsis. Blood culture and empiric antibiotics strongly recommended unless infant is well-appearing with normal vital signs.
Very high risk of early-onset sepsis. Blood culture and empiric antibiotics recommended. Close monitoring in NICU setting may be warranted.

references: Puopolo KM, Draper D, Wi S, et al. Estimating the probability of neonatal early-onset infection on the basis of maternal risk factors. Pediatrics. 2011;128(5):e1155-1163.

Kuzniewicz MW, Walsh EM, Li S, Fischer A, Escobar GJ. Development and implementation of an early-onset sepsis calculator to guide antibiotic management in late preterm and term neonates. Jt Comm J Qual Patient Saf. 2016;42(5):232-239.

Puopolo KM, Benitz WE, Zaoutis TE; Committee on Fetus and Newborn; Committee on Infectious Diseases. Management of Neonates Born at ≥35 0/7 Weeks' Gestation With Suspected or Proven Early-Onset Bacterial Sepsis. Pediatrics. 2018;142(6):e20182894.
formula: EOS risk = 1/(1 + e^(-x)), where x = -6.9325×GA + 0.0877×GA² + 0.8680×Temp(F) + 1.2256×(ROM+0.05)^0.2 + GBS coefficients + Antibiotic coefficients + 40.5656
notes: This calculator is intended for infants born at ≥34 weeks gestation
The calculator estimates risk at birth; clinical examination findings can modify this risk
Temperature should be the highest maternal temperature documented
ROM duration is from time of rupture to delivery
If both broad-spectrum and GBS-specific antibiotics were given, select the broad-spectrum category with appropriate timing
